biography.content:
Mrinal Kaushik is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Aerospace Engineering at IIT Kharagpur. He has earned his Ph.D, M.Tech and B.Tech degrees in Aerospace Engineering in 2012, 2003 and 1999, respectively, from IIT Kanpur. He has a total of 9.0 years of work experience gained at reputed academic/research institutions and renowned industries. Prior to joining IIT Kharagpur, he has also worked at Defence Institute of Advanced Technology (Pune), General Motors Technical Center (Bangalore), Indian Space Research Organization (Trivandrum) and Tata Consultancy Services (Lucknow) in various capacities.
     He has rich experience in teaching courses such as Industrial Aerodynamics, Missile Aerodynamics, High Speed Aerodynamics and Theoretical Aerodynamics. At IIT Kharagpur, he has introduced and developed two new courses, Introduction to Aircraft Armaments and Physics of Fluid Flow Experiments. Dr. Kaushik has authored three text books; Theoretical and Experimental Aerodynamics (Springer Nature, Singapore, 2017), Essentials of Aircraft Armaments (Springer Nature, Singapore, 2016), Innovative Passive Control Techniques for Supersonic Jet Mixing, (Lambert Academic Publishing, Germany, 2012).
     His major research areas are; Shock-Boundary Layer Interactions, Active and Passive Control of Jets, Jet Aeroacoustics and High Enthalpy Flows. His biography is included in the prestigious Marquis Who's Who in the World and he has received Young Researcher Award from Venus International Foundation, India. Dr. Kaushik has been appointed as the First Deputy Director of Post-Induction Training School, Defence Research and Development Organization, Pune, India.

keyword.content: Shock-Boundary Layer Interactions; High-Speed Jets and Base Flows
